snippet: Advisers to Mitt Romney, stung by attacks from Republican rivals on his career as a corporate buyout specialist, are scrambling to avoid a prolonged battle.
abstract: Advisers to Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney, stung by unexpectedly fierce attacks from Republican rivals on his career as a corporate buyout specialist, are scrambling to avoid a nasty battle over his business record before it does him lasting damage; rebut criticisms by telling stories of winners in the world of private equity.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Nicholas Confessore contributed reporting from Manchester, and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from Columbia, S.C.

lead_paragraph: Advisers to Mitt Romney, stung by attacks from Republican rivals on his career as a corporate buyout specialist, are scrambling to avoid a prolonged battle.

headline.seo: Shaken by Attacks on Romney’s Work at Bain, Campaign Tries to Douse Flames
headline.main: Advisers Work to Put Positive Spin on Romney’s Career in Corporate Buyouts
headline.print_headline: Advisers Work to Put Positive Spin on Romney’s Career in Corporate Buyouts
